nodes.description: Herncastle at Seringapatam, diamond guarded by priests
Herncastle steals the diamond
Herncastle has diamond, family ostracizes him, he's dying
Herncastle bequeaths diamond to Rachel
Diamond at Verinder house, birthday dinner, Franklin protective
Dr. Candy doses Franklin with laudanum
Franklin drugged, anxious about diamond, paint wet on door
Franklin takes diamond while unconscious
Franklin has taken diamond to his room unconsciously
Godfrey steals diamond from Franklin
Rachel saw Franklin take diamond, believes he stole it
Rachel maintains silence to protect Franklin
Rosanna finds stained nightgown, loves Franklin
Rosanna hides the evidence
Rosanna has hidden evidence, Franklin oblivious, she despairs
Rosanna commits suicide
Diamond at Luker's for a year, Godfrey desperate, pledge expires
Godfrey reclaims diamond to flee
Godfrey has diamond, Indians have tracked it for 50 years
Indians kill Godfrey, recover diamond
Franklin confused, Rachel hostile, evidence hidden
Ezra Jennings discovers the truth

edges.factors: Herncastle is morally corrupt; Siege provides cover; Diamond is unprotected moment; Herncastle has motive (greed/obsession)
Herncastle is vindictive/bitter; Rachel is innocent/vulnerable; Herncastle wants to spread the curse/trouble; Or: genuine affection for niece
Candy offended by Franklin's dinner remarks; Candy has professional pride wounded; Candy has access to laudanum; Victorian culture of casual drugging
Laudanum effects on memory and volition; Franklin's anxiety about diamond security; Somnambulism is documented effect; No obstacles between rooms
Godfrey is awake (why?); Godfrey has financial desperation; Godfrey sees opportunity; Franklin is unconscious/vulnerable
Rachel loves Franklin; Rachel has fierce pride/principles; Rachel would rather suffer than betray; Victorian women expected to be passive
Rosanna's love for Franklin; Rosanna's outsider status (former thief); Rosanna's desperation; Rosanna can access Shivering Sand
Rosanna's hopeless love; Rosanna's isolation; Victorian limited options for women of her class; The Shivering Sand nearby
Pledge term expiring; Godfrey's embezzlement about to be discovered; Diamond is his only escape
Indians' 50-year sacred mission; They've been patient and determined; Godfrey is alone and vulnerable; No witnesses at the inn
Jennings has Candy's fever-notes; Jennings is brilliant and desperate for meaning; Jennings understands opium; Franklin seeks help
